text: Ally is a digital-only bank.
It's highly imperative for us
that our financial services are available
to our customers whenever they need it.
While we've democratized operations

and federated resiliency, we
saw a need to centrally manage
and align our overall resiliency posture.

The data and the analysis from
AWS Resilience Hub has helped
us implement 100%
of architecture recommendations in our
standard infrastructure.

In the last one and a half
years, we've been able
to onboard 115 applications.
Sharing and bringing transparency

through metrics collected
from Resilience Hub has really

improved our average
application resiliency by 28%.

Leveraging the data and the
analysis we get from

AWS Resilience hub, we've
started to push the boundary

and also embrace AWS
Fault Injection Service so

that we can move from
the tabletop exercises

that we normally do to
really get the results
and attest the predictive analysis we get
from AWS Resilience Hub.
AWS enables us to be agile
and rapidly deliver a highly resilient

and highly reliable
fault tolerance system so

that we can prevent our
customers from near zero
critical failure points.

Collaborating with AWS has
really helped us push the
boundaries of innovation

and what we can deliver
in the financial services,
which is a heavily regulated industry.
It continues to help us innovate,

it continues to help us
provide net new products

to our customers, and
just like AWS, helps us to focus

on our customer needs and put
them front and center.
